intro: Gyrostemon subnudus, commonly known as the slender gyrostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Gyrostemon subnudus is often found in open habitats such as shrublands and grasslands.
